values:
BLUES are motivated by INTIMACY, seek opportunities
to genuinely connect with others, and need to
be appreciated. They do everything with
quality and are devoted and loyal friends and
employers/employees. Whatever or whomever
they commit to are their sole (and soul)
focus. They love to serve and will give
freely of themselves in order to nurture
others lives. BLUES, however, do need to be understood. They have
distinct preferences and occasionally the
somewhat controlling (but always fair)
personality of a confident leader. Their code
of ethics is remarkably strong and they
expect others to live honest, committed lives
as well. They enjoy sharing meaningful
moments in conversation as well as
remembering special life events (i.e.,
birthdays and anniversaries). BLUES are
dependable, thoughtful, nurturing, and can
also be self-righteous, a bit worry-prone,
and emotionally intense. They are like
sainted pit-bulls who never let go of
something once they are committed. When you
deal with a BLUE, be sincere, make an effort
to truly understand them, and truly
appreciate them.

well, i figured i should finally get around to making a new post, since i'm too lazy to send out a bunch of emails. I guess i'll give you highlights, and lowlights, of what's happened since i got here.

Tuesday and Wednesday - almost cried when i said goodbye to the rents. it was sad, they both almost cried too. flight to germany was... interesting. food was bad. german flight attendants are hard to understand over PAs. it is nearly impossible to sleep on airplanes, even after taking Ambien. Frankfurt Airport sucks ass, as it is also a hospital, and my flight was consequently delayed an hour because someone got airlifted into my gate, which wasn't even a gate. i never saw the helicopter, or anyone remotely associated to flight-for-lifes. we went down a staircase to the tarmac, packed onto a transport, and drove a year and a half to the opposite end of the airport complex to our plane, only to be informed that we were 25th in line for takeoff. 

Once at Heathrow, i wondered where on earth they shot those parts of Love Actually and Bend it Like Beckham, because it was kind of... dingy. waited for a long time in Customs, probably 20 minutes, found the luggage, succeeded in not being searched AT ALL, and met up with Toby. he proceeded to get lost trying to find the way from terminal 3 to terminal 2, while i was dragging my heavy suitcases behind me up ramps. met up with Middlesex welcome folks. waited for 2 1/2 hours for the Greek kid to get in, then gave up on him and ordered a coach. he showed up just as we finished loading in to it. made the first dropoff just fine, then waited 1/2 an hour while the bus driver tried to figure out how to get to the next drop. however, about a mile out, driver used the e-brake while stopped on a hill, and the brake stuck.  one of the student helpers received a call that his cousin had been in an accident and may or may not be dying, so he took off. other student helper freaked out. waited 2 hours for another coach to pick us up in rush hour and watched lee evans  dvd. pretty funny stand up. next bus came, listened to driver make fun of all our accents, which was pretty funny. made all the other drop offs and finally got to my campus, YAY! then the driver unloaded my luggage, only to realize that he had mistakenly unloaded one of my cases at the last stop. they went to get it, and i had something to eat that they had saved for me. all in all, i arrived at Heathrow at 2, and got to campus at 9. promptly went to bed.

Thursday - met up with other girl from CSU, YAY! began meetinig other people in Orientation stuff, and then all hell broke loose. This University is ass-backwards and really confusing. They claim to be internet-oriented, but we definitely didn't see that side. we all got massively confused at what we were supposed to do first because they didn't tell us, so much running back and forth from the library and the registration room happened. Yeesh. Went to Asda with another girl that missed the shopping trip the day before, which was pretty interesting, and bought a cellphone. i do not like Asda (uk walmart-owned store, but not nearly as chock-full of goodies). Took the tube!!! i heart the tube. discovered that i had locked keys in room. met neighbor down the hall named Waquer (wacker), who let me keep groceries in his room while i hunted down the security guard. keys were on bed. waq rocks.

Friday - Forced to more orientation shit at Enfield campus. Blew off as much of it as possible, and instead went to Tesco (safeway-owned store). I heart tesco. went to a pub in Southgate with some of the other girls who are totally sweet and inhaled our first real meal of the trip. Fish and chips are wonderful. so are no taxes and no tips. then went to mini tesco at the end of our road.

Saturday - TOUR OF LONDON!!!!! it was great! went to st. paul's cathedral, the millenium bridge, Westminster abbey, the U.S. embassy, Piccadilly circus, leicester square, covent gardens, big ben and the houses of parliament, the royal opera house, Trafalgar square, the National Gallery, st. james palace, buckingham palace, #10 downing street, the tower bridge, the tower of london, chinatown, and also got lost. it was fantastic. also found a great little hole-in-the-wall Thai restaurant with phenomenal pad thai. yuuuuuuummmmmmm. went back via tube during rush hour, which was slightly scary. it takes around 40 minutes, but that's ok. then went to emily's room to make dinner and watch a movie with virginia, then discussed traveling and where we all want to go. woot. then made to go to bed, but went to erica's room instead and hung out for a while. she gave me her spare ethernet cord, so everyone must love erica. and she's a big sweety. got online, chatted with the fam for a while, crashed at 4 and didn't wake up til past noon. neither did anyone else. almost everyone sat around in jammies all day doing nothing except dreading class. finally got dressed, emily and i did a load of laundry together (SO expensive), wandered around campus a bit, discovered the other bar, made dinner, went to mini tesco again, then intended to watch a dvd, but instead talked with a bunch of girls.

yup. there it is. i went to my first seminar this morning, the class should be cake, and now i still have an hour until my next one. i promise i'll start up dating this more often and keep y'all up-to-date with what i'm doing.

cheers!
